metadata.titel_preek: Father, into thy hands I commend my spirit

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The cosmic battle between Christ and the Power of Darkness on the Cross to achieve the salvation and redemption of humanity.

tekstueel_bewijs: preparing to engage the ancient Enemy mano a mano
Jesus waging a battle on the Cross
struggle to absorb into himself the malice

object.identificatie: Salvation/Redemption and the casting out of the Ruler of this World
tekstueel_bewijs: battle for the salvation of the world
bringing you and me into the near presence of that same Father

zender.identificatie: The Father / The Decree from the beginning
tekstueel_bewijs: conflict decreed for him from the beginning
I must be about my Father's business
all for the sake of bringing you and me
In his suffering we find our redemption
The Psalms have always been the foundation
we, by faith, are assimilated to Christ

tegenstander.identificatie: The Devil / Power of Darkness / Malice / Death
tekstueel_bewijs: the malice of those who were reviling him
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not merely human bad habits but a 'Power' and 'Ruler' that requires a divine combatant.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The believer's response: committing one's spirit to God in imitation of and through Christ.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer/Believer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The believer's 'giving' is a response to Christ's 'giving' ('Thou didst give thyself for me/Now I give myself to thee').

voorbeelden_god_subject: the ruler of this world shall be cast out
Jesus was entirely directed to the ultimate welfare of others
Your crucified Lord holds out his arms to you
voorbeelden_mens_subject: we are trying to gain some deeper understanding
You can make these words your own
we also are assimilated to him

voorbeelden: first he must suffer many things

the love that will not let you go
the one who was looking for a word of redemption

trying to gain some deeper understanding

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes Christ's unique power (Pouvoir) to endure the cross and the Father's power to hold the believer, rather than the believer's obligation (Devoir).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: The sermon moves from the darkness of S2 (abandonment/battle) to the resolution of S1 (Father's hands) via Christ's performance.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Christ absorbs the 'malice' (not-S1) and 'dereliction' (S2) to open the 'Father's hands' (S1) for the receiver.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High. The sermon explicitly rejects 'sentimentalizing' and 'golden twilight' in favor of 'agony' and 'battle'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. Christ is the primary actant in the battle for salvation, and the human response is framed as being 'assimilated' into His finished work.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Luke is teaching us how to die and how to live.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: In his suffering we find our redemption.
preparing to engage the ancient Enemy mano a mano.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Jesus is presented as the model for prayer and trust, but this is grounded in His ontological victory first.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides this: we don't just copy Jesus; we are 'assimilated' to Him.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and trust; being 'held' by the Father.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Soteriology precedes and enables Christian living.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from Christ's cosmic battle to the believer's personal trust is seamless.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'forgiveness is hard work' (human effort) and Christ's 'absorbing malice' (divine work).

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: It is the battle for the salvation of the world... the ruler of this world be cast out.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon attributes the 'Pouvoir' to the Father's hand and Christ's prayer rather than explicitly naming the Spirit.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Severe; described as 'the power of darkness' and 'malice' that requires a 'huge cost'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God/Christ as the Subject of the primary narrative program. The hearer is correctly positioned as the Receiver of the benefits of Christ's 'performance'.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Slightly low on the 'how' of the Spirit's work.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Explicitly mention how the Holy Spirit 'assimilates' us to Christ.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Maintain the current order: Christ's Battle -> Our Redemption -> Our Trust.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterful example of a grace-oriented sermon that uses the 'Christus Victor' motif to ground human experience in divine action.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the use of the Alexander Maclaren quote, Greimas shows that the quote functions to shift the 'Sender' role to the Father's hand.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis might focus on the Greek of 'commit', but semiotics reveals the 'Object' is not just a spirit, but the 'welfare of others'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that the 'Opponent' is the engine of this sermon; without the 'Power of Darkness', the 'Father's hands' would seem sentimental.

appendices.notities: The sermon avoids the 'moralistic trap' by making the imitation of Christ a result of 'assimilation' rather than mere willpower.
